title: Lidded Jar (yu)
text: Made at a time when bronze had gained its ascendancy, this covered container closely resembles a type of bronze ceremonial wine container termed <I>yu<I>. A small animal mask has been carved on center near the rim of the otherwise smooth vessel in close approximation of late Shang and early Chou ritual bronzes.
description: Yu, with cover, of black pottery with small Tao Chi mask on each side. Top of cover, with simple knob finial, decorated with incised lines and two minute portruding wedge-shaped bosses; coating of clay on inside and thin deposit on outside.
